TopicTitle: "Plan Kappa" - A KSP graphic novel (Jeb is back in Chapter 53! Well, kinda.)

Articles.Content:
7 hours ago, Parkaboy said:

I guess with all those Jebs running around no one will miss the Kappa one, right?

Don't tease, please... :'(

On 24/03/2016 at 6:11 AM, FyunchClick said:

Don't tease, please... :'(

Ok, no more teasing. How about the start of a new volume?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Edited March 30, 2016 by Parkaboy
Adding 10 extra kerbals
I think Fabien is your absolute best character in this series. Excellently written
JEB!!

More like she doesn't know that theres an additional survivor and the rovers communications don't work.

Here's hoping Jeb survives somehow.
Jeb isn't dead... Or, probably not. Remember what happened to the other kerbals who were orbiting Kerbin when it exploded? The ones from the other timelines?

Well, they never found the body, but of course the proper thing for us to do is mourn his death so that Parkaboy can surprise us in the future, if he so wishes.

Jeb, noo! Nooooooooooooooo!

10 minutes ago, RocketSquid said:

Jeb isn't dead... Or, probably not. Remember what happened to the other kerbals who were orbiting Kerbin when it exploded? The ones from the other timelines?

 

Wasn't Stelrine also orbiting Kerbin at the time or at least still in the SoI? I'm not sure how much time actually elapsed between the Mun exploding and Kerbin itself exploding.

Just now, smjjames said:

Wasn't Stelrine also orbiting Kerbin at the time or at least still in the SoI? I'm not sure how much time actually elapsed between the Mun exploding and Kerbin itself exploding.

Wasn't she caught in the Munsplosion? I could've sworn she was.

3 minutes ago, RocketSquid said:

Wasn't she caught in the Munsplosion? I could've sworn she was.

She was caught in the blast, yes, but she got teleported to Eve somehow instead of to some alternate universe.

Whether Jeb got sent to an alternate universe or was teleported somewhere else in the system, us readers don't know right now.

Dire news indeed! Thanks Parkaboy for the recap of Fabien's story, and also for the convenient guide to "who's where". Val's speech is inspiring, but she may have made a mistake in not explicitly saying who's in charge at each location. If kerbs disagree, she won't even necessarily be awake to sort it out--and like she said, they have to stick together!
Way cool seeing all that's left... and those IVAs, holy smokes those are good. My hats off to @Nils277, that's some really good stuff.

Very good update.  I'll second Kuzzter in thanking you for the 'Program' telling us who and what is where.

I hope everybody realizes just how important unity is now.  Dire is an understatement!

Happy landings!

15 minutes ago, Starhawk said:

Very good update.  I'll second Kuzzter in thanking you for the 'Program' telling us who and what is where.

I hope everybody realizes just how important unity is now.  Dire is an understatement!

Happy landings!

Yes, how dire Unity5 is now.

/lamejoke

2 hours ago, Kuzzter said:

Dire news indeed! Thanks Parkaboy for the recap of Fabien's story, and also for the convenient guide to "who's where". Val's speech is inspiring, but she may have made a mistake in not explicitly saying who's in charge at each location. If kerbs disagree, she won't even necessarily be awake to sort it out--and like she said, they have to stick together!

Yeah, something tells me that Val would be a bad lawyer...

Edited March 25, 2016 by Andem
Hmmmm... Duna Space program?
She explicitly declined to name leaders, merely suggesting that each crew should choose their own, and work it out from there.  She has a lot of faith in her fellow survivors.

15 minutes ago, Commander Zoom said:

She explicitly declined to name leaders, merely suggesting that each crew should choose their own, and work it out from there.  She has a lot of faith in her fellow survivors.

Makes sense anyways. Val is going into hibernation, plus all the Kerbals are so spread out, keeping a centralized command structure is near impossible to maintain. It made sense to declare each ship self governing and autonomous.

A logo change I see! Also, considering there is fog on Eve, I wonder if the other planets have interesting phenomenon... Coincedentally, the name of this chapter is the same as the newest one for my graphic novel.

Dark Predictions and wild speculation!

1. The crew of the hardihood will undermine Bobs authority until he either gives up and jumps ship or maybe they make him.

2. The crew of feather base will continue experiencing medical problems until they are all incapacitated just short of implementing a solution to their micro gravity seizures.

3. There are two kerbals on eve but only one escape rocket with a capacity of one some one's getting stranded

4. If anyone can work out how to repopulate the kerbals without hampering productivity it would be the resident evil genius of the Zonkers and they are gonna need to cause...

5. Longburn doesn't stand a chance it's a boat of red shirts... Might as well say there are 22 kerbals left right now...

6. Jeb is thrown into the distant past and in order to find kerbin again and save it he gets his new alien friends to build and send out the monolithes competing the cycle.

7 hours ago, Deddly said:

I think Fabien is your absolute best character in this series. Excellently written

I guess that's probably because he's the most fleshed out character outside the "orange team"...

6 hours ago, smjjames said:

Wasn't Stelrine also orbiting Kerbin at the time or at least still in the SoI? I'm not sure how much time actually elapsed between the Mun exploding and Kerbin itself exploding.

Roughly 5 days between the Mun and Kerbin explosions. Stelrine was probably transported a few days forward - as well as going from a munar suborbital trajectory to one on Eve.

2 hours ago, passinglurker said:

Dark Predictions and wild speculation!

1. The crew of the hardihood will undermine Bobs authority until he either gives up and jumps ship or maybe they make him.

2. The crew of feather base will continue experiencing medical problems until they are all incapacitated just short of implementing a solution to their micro gravity seizures.

3. There are two kerbals on eve but only one escape rocket with a capacity of one some one's getting stranded

4. If anyone can work out how to repopulate the kerbals without hampering productivity it would be the resident evil genius of the Zonkers and they are gonna need to cause...

5. Longburn doesn't stand a chance it's a boat of red shirts... Might as well say there are 22 kerbals left right now...

6. Jeb is thrown into the distant past and in order to find kerbin again and save it he gets his new alien friends to build and send out the monolithes competing the cycle.

 

You're definitely onto something here... on some of those points!
Jeb aint dead. Mah feels say so.
It said that Fabien is one of 40 kerbals in the universe... Val thinks there is 39 because Jeb "died". JEB LIVES!

3 hours ago, Laythe Dweller said:

It said that Fabien is one of 40 kerbals in the universe... Val thinks there is 39 because Jeb "died". JEB LIVES!

Val thinks there are 39 because she thinks Stelrine died.

I just found this thread.... I started reading and then stopped.... dead.... no more.

I might be a bad bad person for saying this, but I hate bad grammar.

betted????????

Sir..... respectfully....

"I bet him"
"he bet me"
"I bet you"
You bet me"


There is no such word as "betted"

Sorry.
